definition: Manhattan island/Manhattan borough of New York City
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
Manhattan borough of New York City

sentences.english: It's 45th North Street, Manhattan, New York, US.
sentences.chinese: 美國紐約曼哈頓區北大街45號。

sentences.english: Thick dust and smoke rush through downtown Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 濃煙與灰塵衝過曼哈頓下城的街道。

sentences.english: I mean, it’s just a tall building where you go out on the roof in the middle of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，爬到曼哈頓中區一幢高樓的頂樓平臺。

sentences.english: parallel to here. If you were to look at Manhattan
sentences.chinese: 與這兒平行。如果你打算去看曼哈頓，

sentences.english: Mainly for the reasons that, you know, Manhattan is very expensive.
sentences.chinese: 主要是因爲曼哈頓的物價太貴了。

sentences.english: It's very different from the east side of Manhattan which is, quiet, quiet, quiet.
sentences.chinese: 這裏與靜謐的曼哈頓上東區截然不同。

sentences.english: Good morning, Lower Manhattan Development Corporation, LMDC.
sentences.chinese: 早上好，曼哈頓下城發展公司。

sentences.english: This is Manhattan. Even the shrinks have shrinks.
sentences.chinese: 這是曼哈頓，甚至連心理醫生都有心理醫生。

sentences.english: D to re-edit a scene showing moon rocks raining on manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 中曼哈頓遭受月球岩石雨襲擊的鏡頭進行重新剪輯。

sentences.english: Brooklyn is probably just as popular to live as Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 住在布魯克林可能和曼哈頓一樣受歡迎。

sentences.english: Rufus: Like, "maybe I never should've left Manhattan" fine
sentences.chinese: 是“也許我不該離開曼哈頓”那種好。

sentences.english: Manhattan, it is well-known, is an island nation governed by peacocks.
sentences.chinese: 曼哈頓，衆所周知，是一個被孔雀統治的島國。

sentences.english: A large part of the city is on Manhatten Island, a big island in the river.
sentences.chinese: 城市很大一部分都在曼哈頓島上，這是河中的一座島。

sentences.english: But for the tribe of the upper-eastside of Manhattan, it takes just one person.
sentences.chinese: 但是對曼哈頓上東區的富人來說，只需要一個人。

sentences.english: It felt like downtown Manhattan after the Sept. 11 attacks.
sentences.chinese: 這裏就像是911襲擊後的曼哈頓下城。

sentences.english: in Manhattan with the exception of 42nd street, 14th street.
sentences.chinese: 除了曼哈頓的第42街和第14街。

definition: Chinatown/also called 唐人街[Tang2 ren2 jie1]
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
Brooklyn, borough of New York City
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
